The 11-minute 46-second video has been viewed more than 98,000 times after being posted here on YouTube on December 13, 2020.
The video’s Tagalog-language title translates to English as: "BREAKING NEWS TODAY DECEMBER 13, 2020 PRES. DUTERTE HAS MADE THOUSANDS OF N P A SURRENDER ! WATCH!"
Text on the video claims the number of supposed surrenderees is “10,000”.
“NPA” is the acronym of the New People’s Army, the armed wing of the Communist Party of the Philippines.
The video circulated online a day after the Philippine military announced some 300 NPA members had surrendered to the military in the northern Philippines.
The video has also been shared here, here, here on Facebook, and on this blog, alongside similar claims.

Reverse image searches of the video’s keyframes extracted using InVID-WeVerify, a digital verification tool, followed by keyword searches, found a longer version of the video published here on the Philippine government’s YouTube account, dated January 23, 2020.

The video description reads, in part: “President Rodrigo Roa Duterte led the distribution of benefits to former rebels (FRs) in a ceremony held at the San Isidro Civic Center (SICC) in San Isidro, Leyte.

“Around 262 FRs are covered by the benefits that included immediate financial assistance, livelihood assistance from the Enhanced Comprehensive Local Integration Program (E-CLIP), as well as financial assistance from the Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD) and the provincial government of Leyte.”
Below is a screenshot comparison of keyframes from the video in the misleading posts (L) and the January 2020 YouTube video (R):
In response to the misleading posts, the Philippine Armed Forces directed AFP to a press release dated December 12, 2020.
The statement reads, in part: “A total of 201 members of the communist terrorist group New People's Army fall [sic] in relentless internal security operations so far this year.

“Information collected from military units on the ground also report that 7,615 fighters, militias, propagandists, and underground organization members and supporters have returned to the fold of law.”
